title: Pregnant EastEnders star Melissa Suffield admits fears her child will 'be a p***k'
text:

EastEnders actress Melissa Suffield, who once played Lucy Beale, has shared a brutally honest post as she opened up about pregnancy anxiety.

"Will my kid be a p***k?" the mum-to-be feared on Instagram , which was captioned in block capitals.

The actress, 26, admitted pregnancy is lonely as she listed her other concerns alongside a picture of her growing baby bump.

The star who played Lucy between 2004 and 2010 told her fans: "Growing a person is a RIDE," and that she has " cellulite everywhere," a "hairy belly" and "random loud hiccups ".

The pregnancy news came last month as Melissa and her fiancee Robert Brendan are expecting their first baby together - just three months after getting engaged.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

The former soap star launched into the pros and cons of pregnancy as she was pictured in a mirror cradling her rather large bump with a smirk on her face.

She complained: "Cellulite everywhere. Like, a**e, arms, thighs, even my knees. It is VERY annoying.

"My skin refuses to retain moisture. We’re talking a THICK serving of Eight Hour Cream all over my face every single night, and still waking up to a bone dry boat.

(Image: Instagram)

"Random loud hiccups at any time of day. Following no pattern, and with no warning- the runs. Maybe 5 times a day, maybe once a week. WHO KNOWS.

"I’m still taking naps. I NEVER nap.

"The anxiety is real. Will I still be me when I’m a mother? Will everything be ok? WILL MY KID BE A P***K"

(Image: Instagram)

And she finished off the long list of negatives with: "Pregnancy is lonely. Oh, the headaches. The headaches."

Slowly adjusting to pregnancy, Melissa admitted she's "been lucky to avoid" vomiting and constipation and confessed her leg hair growth has slowed down.

(Image: Instagram)

Nevertheless, Melissa told The Sun that she can't wait to be a mum.

She said: "We're so excited to become parents.

"This next step is an adventure, and we’re looking forward to raising a happy, healthy, inquisitive, strong, and accepting child, and starting our own little family, as a trio!"

Cruise director Robert added: "I'm over the moon but nervous too! Melissa is so used to kids, and she’ll be an amazing mum instantly."
description: The former soap star has shared a list of pregnancy fears after announcing she's expecting her first child
